Blog

Work Experience

Web Development Assistant | Ministry of Transporation
May 2016 - August 2016

I worked on COAnalysis project which is a GUI that allows the users to parses excel files listing Ministry Content Owners to obtain relevant data. The tool was created to help in the content review process. I also created HTML versions for all Road Talk issues from 2016-2010. The aim was to replace the PDF issues with a more accessible format.

Languages: Python, HTML, CSS

Personal Projects

Markov Chain
winter 2016

Implemented a markov chain that reads a text file and creates a transition matrix, using n-grams. It then generates text based on the transition matric

Languages: Written in python using numpy and ntlk.

SafetyTab
summer 2016

Safety Tab is a Google Chrome extension that allows users to quickly load a website from a predetermined list in a new tab. This is perfect for when you need to pretend to do homework as your parents look over your shoulder! This project was a fun idea I decided to play around with while I experimented with asynchronous programming in JavaScript.

Languages: Javascipt, HTML, CSS + Chrome's Javascript API's

CodeNotes
fall 2015

CodeNotes is a dual purpose editor for computer science students. It allows for rich text editing as well as text-editing for code. This is perfect when a student needs to take detailed and organized notes while also quickly typing up some code. CodeNotes is my first project written in JavaScript and Local Storage. Looking back, Iâ€™m pretty embarrassed by the code, but so proud of all the things I learned.

Languages: Javascipt, HTML, CSS

Opensource Projects

PowerPortfolio
winter 2016

PowerPortfolio is a Flask application that uses a database to store information about projects in the portfolio. I implemented a feature show/hide feature in the API that allows users to decide which project will with rendered in the front end of the portfolio, and added the capability to allow users to update the project details once project was created.

Languages: Python

Duck Duck Go Instant Answers - Sass Fathead
summer 2016

I created a new Sass Fathead Instant Answer, which provides quick answers to Sass related search query's by parsing the Sass documentation.

Languages: Python

School Projects

Paint Program

Create a program mimics MS Paint by allowing users to draw shapes on screen and save their creations. I worked in a team of four, using Scrum and git to manage workflow.

Languages: Java

Final Grade: 80%

Puzzle Solver

Create a program that can solve Peg Solitaire Puzzles, MN Puzzles, Word Ladder Puzzles and Sudoku puzzles using either Breadth-first search or Depth-first search.

Languages: Python

Final Grade: 92 %
